posts.post_content: Devastating outside of its block - with so many artifact creatures in *Mirrodin*, this was somewhat hampered. But reprinted in *Divine vs Demonic*, this card showed its worth, especially since it was one of only a few things that could kill [Akroma, Angel of Wrath](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Akroma, Angel of Wrath) (as well as her entire team!) A truly devastating creature, and one that makes the game all but won in most situations when it hits the board. If it doesn't gain you enough card advantage when played, it even has a 6/6 Flying body with no drawbacks that stays behind to mop up after the carnage.
posts.html:
Devastating outside of its block - with so many artifact creatures in Mirrodin, this was somewhat hampered. But reprinted in Divine vs Demonic, this card showed its worth, especially since it was one of only a few things that could kill Akroma, Angel of Wrath (as well as her entire team!) A truly devastating creature, and one that makes the game all but won in most situations when it hits the board. If it doesn't gain you enough card advantage when played, it even has a 6/6 Flying body with no drawbacks that stays behind to mop up after the carnage.
